{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM><NOTE>6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinerga√ü sind zu verkauffen:</NOTE> 
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Prideaun A. und N. Testam</TITLE>
    <NOTE>in einer Connex. mit der V√∂lcker-Historie</NOTE>
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1725</YEAR>
    <VOLUME>4. II. Tom. 1. Vol. 2</VOLUME>
    <PRIZE>Cattenburg</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>4.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>8r. 70.</VOLUME>
    <AUTHOR>Interpp. Reineccii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8√≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl. Hebr.</TITLE>
    <AUTHOR>punctata Leusdenii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Frf.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1694</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>12.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Seldenus</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>de Diis Syris</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1692</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Gottschedens</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>critische Dichtkunst</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Leipzig</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8v√≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>B√∂dickers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Grunds√§tze der Deutschen Sprach</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1729</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8v√≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the introductory sale phrase '6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinerga√ü sind zu verkauffen:' in a <NOTE> element inside <ITEM> to keep it as structured text instead of leaving it as bare text.
2) Closed the missing </BIBL> tag after the record with TITLE 'Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas' to restore well-formed XML.
3) Moved the second <BIBL> (beginning with <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>) out of the previous <BIBL> so that BIBL elements are siblings rather than being improperly nested.
4) Escaped the ampersand '&' in 'de Vita & Scriptis' as '&' to satisfy XML entity rules.
5) Normalized the corrupted roman numeral and text fragments where they were clearly intended as text, e.g. '1I.' to 'II.' in the <VOLUME> field; kept other mojibake characters (√ü, √∂, √≤, √§) as-is but ensured they are within element content so they do not break XML.
6) Ensured each <BIBL> element has a consistent internal structure (TITLE / AUTHOR / PLACE / YEAR / FORMAT / VOLUME / PRIZE as applicable) and that all opened tags are properly closed, producing a single well-formed XML fragment."}

  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE>

  </BIBL>

    <VOLUME>8r. 70.</VOLUME>
    <AUTHOR>Interpp. Reineccii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>

  </BIBL>

  </BIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Wrapped the introductory sale phrase '6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinerga√ü sind zu verkauffen:' in a <NOTE> element inside <ITEM> to keep it as structured text instead of leaving it as bare text.
2) Closed the missing </BIBL> tag after the record with TITLE 'Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas' to restore well-formed XML.
3) Moved the second <BIBL> (beginning with <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>) out of the previous <BIBL> so that BIBL elements are siblings rather than being improperly nested.
4) Escaped the ampersand '&' in 'de Vita & Scriptis' as '&' to satisfy XML entity rules.
5) Normalized the corrupted roman numeral and text fragments where they were clearly intended as text, e.g. '1I.' to 'II.' in the <VOLUME> field; kept other mojibake characters (√ü, √∂, √≤, √§) as-is but ensured they are within element content so they do not break XML.
6) Ensured each <BIBL> element has a consistent internal structure (TITLE / AUTHOR / PLACE / YEAR / FORMAT / VOLUME / PRIZE as applicable) and that all opened tags are properly closed, producing a single well-formed XML fragment.
